messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] Re: Computer Programming
messages.msgSnippet: DigiPen http://digipen.com is a school that trains game developers. I don t know much about their programs, but I see on the website that they offer distance
messages.messageBody:
DigiPen http://digipen.com is a school that trains game developers. I
don't know much about their programs, but I see on the website that
they offer distance learning.

Sara

messages.subject: Re: Computer Programming
messages.msgSnippet: ... Trayton, 12, uses GameMaker 6.0 which has a useful little freeware version and a bigger one that costs about $20 I think.  You can play the first game he
messages.messageBody:
> Also, he loves video games, he is wonderful

> at figuring them out. Are there any sites to help encourage

> actually making video games?

Trayton, 12, uses GameMaker 6.0 which has a useful little freeware version
and a bigger one that costs about $20 I think. You can play the first game
he wrote by himself on our hopelessly out of date website.
http://www.lemoncrab.com and click on [download Riu Pong 1.0]

The characters fighting each other are drawings he made on paper and scanned
in.

The game is the only thing dh has had time to update this year. I guess I
could do it myself...

Krisula



[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
